title: 115_hr2340
content: The curr_chunk is a section titled "EXTENSION OF SECURE RURAL SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY SELF-DETERMINATION ACT OF 2000." The curr_chunk discusses amending the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 to change the year from 2015 to 2017 for secure payments to states and counties containing federal land. Additionally, a special rule for fiscal year 2016 payments is added. The amendment reduces state and county payments for fiscal year 2016 if they have already received a share of the payment. The Secretary of the Treasury must make all payments within 45 days of enactment. The amendment modifies payment amounts for fiscal years 2014 through 2017 under the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000. The amendment changes payment amounts for fiscal years 2014 through 2017 under the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 by updating the expenditure rules for eligible counties. The amendment modifies payment rules for fiscal years 2014 through 2017 under the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 by expanding the purposes for which funds can be used. The Determination Act of 2000 is amended to specify that funds for eligible counties cannot be used to replace state funding for schools. Additionally, the distribution of payments to eligible counties is updated from 2015 to 2017. The authority to conduct special projects on federal land is continued by repealing a contracting pilot program. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is amended to update resource advisory committees, availability of project funds, and termination of authority timelines. The changes include updating dates from 2012 to 2017, 2017 to 2019, and 2018 respectively. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is amended to update termination dates from 2017 to 2019 and 2018 to 2020. The House of Representatives aims to offset the costs of these changes.
